p: The identified endophytic strains exhibited varied salt tolerance and their growth was reduced with increasing NaCl concentration in growth media. As seen in Table 1, γ-negative bacteria, A. radioresistant PI-3, and B. cepacia PI-15 were more sensitive to NaCl and showed weak growth at 150 mM NaCl. By increasing the salt concentration, their growth was inhibited. α-Proteobacteria ( A. fabrum) and firmicutes species ( B. brevis, B. cereus, B. subtilis, and P. barengoltzii) exhibited high salt tolerance up to 200 mM, and their growth was inhibited by increasing the NaCl concentration above this level.
